alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Gasconade; Iron; Madison; Osage; Reynolds; St. Francois; Warren; Washington (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 02 at 10:00AM CDT until August 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH HAS EXPIRED... The Flash Flood Watch has expired for portions of central, east central, and southeast Missouri, including the following areas, in central Missouri, Osage MO. In east central Missouri, Crawford MO, Franklin MO, Gasconade MO, Warren MO and Washington MO. In southeast Missouri, Iron MO, Madison MO, Reynolds MO and Saint Francois MO. The flash flooding threat has ended. Therefore, the Flash Flood Watch has expired. && ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and southeast Missouri, including the following areas, in central Missouri, Osage MO. In east central Missouri, Crawford MO, Franklin MO, Gasconade MO, Warren MO and Washington MO. In southeast Missouri, Iron MO, Madison MO, Reynolds MO and Saint Francois MO. * WHEN...From this evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall rates are likely this evening. Multiple rounds of heavy thunderstorm rainfall could lead to very high rainfall totals and lead to flash flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Crawford; Franklin; Gasconade; Iron; Madison; Osage; Reynolds; St. Francois; Warren; Washington
